name: Montu
subtitle: God of War and the Bull
description: Montu is the falcon-headed war god associated with the bull. Once supreme god of Thebes before being supplanted by Amun. God of military victory, martial prowess, and the raging bull's strength. Depicted with bull horns and sun disk. Pharaohs called themselves 'Mighty Bull, Son of Montu' when emphasizing military might.

The author has developed extensive theories connecting Egyptian deity mythology to scientific concepts, particularly radioactive isotopes, chemical compounds, and physical processes. These interpretations explore potential encoding of advanced knowledge in ancient Egyptian religious symbolism.
